moves.1. e4 e6 2. c4 d5 3. Nc3 Nh6 4. Nf3 dxe4: White's first major mistake, White shouldn't have taken the bishop, as the rook is lost in the subsequent skewer.
White's second major mistake, allowing black to remove the f-file pawns by blocking the a7 bishop with the b pawn.
moves.30... Rxf2+ 31. Kb3 Rxf3 32. a5 h5 33. K: Black's First major mistake, not moving the king to a6 and locking up the pawn promotion race on the a- and b-ranks.
moves.34. Kb5 Rxc3 35. a6+ Kc8: Black's second major mistake, last chance to prevent the promotions should have been 35... Ka8 36. b7+ Kxa7
moves.38. Kc5 Rxb8 39. Bxb8 Kc8 40. Bxf4: White removes blacks last chance of getting promotions, and somewhat decides the game.
